thread.title: UCA women's soccer to honor two seniors
thread.title_full: UCA women's soccer to honor two seniors

author: Staff
title: UCA women's soccer to honor two seniors
text:
UCA women's soccer to honor two seniors Posted: October 15, 2015 - 6:56pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
The Univesity of Central Arkansas women’s soccer team will honor the careers of senior Megan Thomas and junior Kate Koch prior to Friday night’s match against Houston Baptist at the Bill Stephens Complex. 
Thomas, the Bears’ lone senior, and Koch, who will be graduating early, will be suiting up for their final home stand this weekend. 
Thomas, from Arlington, Texas, is the only true senior on the Central Arkansas roster this season. 
Despite missing time this season while rehabbing from an injury, Thomas has appeared in 39 games during her career for a total of 1,237 minutes played. 
She has assisted on two goals while taking five shots. Thomas will receive a degree in math. 
Koch, from Mansfield, Texas, is just a junior, but will be graduating early with a degree in finance. In three seasons, she has made 44 starts and seen action in 50 games, playing a total of 3,155 minutes. 
She has scored five goals and assisted on three more, while placing 21 of her 48 attempts on target. 
Koch has one game-winning goal in her career and has converted one penalty kick. 
Houston Baptist (6-4-1, 4-2-0 SLC) is the fourth-ranked squad in the Southland, holding 12 points through six matches.
